EXTRACTED VALUE: Renaldo Balkman is hoping to return to practice Friday, a key step towards recovery from a bulging disk in his back.
Warriors big man Louis Amundson has had the splint on his right hand removed but there is still no timetable for his return.
The Spanish team Caja Laboral has released Pops Mensah-Bonsu, possibly because of a knee injury.
Paul Millsap is not one of the four Jazz players on this year's All-Star ballots -- but the list includes injured center Mehmet Okur.
Shawne Williams made the Knicks' regular season roster, thanks to his slimmed-down frame and improved shooting.
Doc Rivers might consider benching Rajon Rondo (knee, hamstring, foot) for a stretch of games if needed.
J.J. Redick will miss Wednesday's game due to a stomach virus.
Craig Smith (back) practiced on Monday but was limited to non-contact drills, and is questionable for Wednesday's season opener.
There have been no recent updates on the status of Knicks swingman Kelenna Azubuike (knee).
Jordan Farmar scored 14 points on 5-of-10 shooting (3-of-8 from downtown) with two rebounds and five assists in 27 minutes off the bench.
Coach Vinny Del Negro said that Randy Foye (hamstring) is unlikely to play on Monday.
Coach Larry Brown said that Tyrus Thomas' insertion into the starting lineup Wednesday night was simply matchup based.
Andrea Bargnani hit 8-of-19 shots for 23 points, nine rebounds, two assists, two steals, a block and two more 3-pointers in Wednesday's loss.
Kyle Lowry had 13 points, eight assists and six steals on 6-of-10 shooting in Monday's loss to the Suns.
Pacers big man Solomon Jones (elbow) isn't expected to play at Charlotte on Friday.
Shannon Brown hit just 1-of-5 shots for four points in 16 minutes on Wendesday.
Owner Mark Cuban said the Mavericks will pick up J.J. Barea's team option for 2010/11.
Ryan Hollins has reportedly been suspended for two games for throwing a forearm at Dirk Nowitzki and throwing a punch at DeShawn Stevenson on Monday.
